tags.name: Metastore: dataset
tags.description: CRUD operations for dataset metastore items. Substitute any other schema name for "dataset" to modify other items.

get.description: Returns a list of all stored importers, with data about their file fetcher and status.

post.description: Immediately starts the import process for a datastore.

get.description: Returns the numbers of rows and columns, and a list of columns headers from the datastore.

delete.description: Delete one or more datastores. If the uuid parameter is that of a resource, delete that resource. If the uuid parameter is that of a dataset, delete all resources of that dataset.

get.summary: Query one or more datastore resources
get.description: Simple GET equivalent of a POST query. Note that parameters containing arrays or objects are not yet supported by SwaggerUI. For conditions, sorts, and other complex parameters, write your query in JSON and then convert to a nested query string. See [this web tool](https://www.convertonline.io/convert/json-to-query-string) for an example.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: Resources to query against and aliases. Usually you will add only one resource to this array, but if performing a join, list the primary resource first and then add resources to be used in the joins array.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: Conditions or groups of conditions for the query, bound by 'and' operator.

parameters.name: joins
parameters.description: Joins

parameters.name: groupings
parameters.description: Properties or aliases to group results by.

parameters.name: sorts
parameters.description: Result sorting directives.

post.summary: Query one or more datastore resources

For more reliable queries, write your query in JSON and then convert to a query string. See [this web tool](https://www.convertonline.io/convert/json-to-query-string) for an example.

get.description: Interact with resources in the datastore using an SQL-like syntax.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
A SQL-like query.

A `SELECT` using the `show_db_columns` parameter will make it easier to build queries against the data as
it returns columns without spaces and in some cases, truncated names where the human readable column header
is very long.

`/api/1/datastore/sql?query=[SELECT * FROM DATASTORE_UUID][LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0];&show_db_columns`

You can then build the `SELECT` part of the query. Do not use spaces between its arguments.

`/api/1/datastore/sql?query=[SELECT a,b,c, FROM DATASTORE_UUID]`

`WHERE` can use any column in the data.

`/api/1/datastore/sql?query=[SELECT a,b FROM DATASTORE_UUID][WHERE c = "CCC"];&show_db_columns`

`LIMIT` and `OFFSET` allow you to get more than the 500 record limit, by using successive queries:

`/api/1/datastore/sql?query=[SELECT a,b,c FROM DATASTORE_UUID][WHERE d = "CCC"][LIMIT 500 OFFSET 0];&show_db_columns`

`/api/1/datastore/sql?query=[SELECT a,b,c FROM DATASTORE_UUID][WHERE d = "DDD"][LIMIT 500 OFFSET 500];&show_db_columns`

Note: `SELECT`, `WHERE` and `LIMIT...OFFSET` clauses must each be included within brackets `[ ]`.

parameters.name: show_db_columns
parameters.description:
Add `&show_db_columns` to return columns without spaces and in some cases, truncated names where the human
readable column header is very long.

get.description: Lists the identifiers of all registered harvests.

post.description: Registers a new harvest, after validating against our schema.

400.description: Bad request. Usually a mistake in the JSON.

get.description: Get the json plan of a registered harvest, based on the its harvest id.
Gives information about a previous run for a specific harvest run.

get.summary: List previous runs for a harvest id
get.description: Lists the identifiers (timestamps) of previous runs for a particular harvest id.

post.description: Runs a harvest for a specific plan identifier inside json object payload.

schema.description: Full collection of available metastore schemas

get.summary: Get all items for a specific schema (e.g., "dataset")

200.description: Full list of all items for the given schema

schema.description: Array of metastore items matching the chosen schema.

get.summary: Get all revisions for an item.

requestBody.description: Post a new revision object to change an item's moderation state. Simultaneous metastore item content changes and state changes not currently possible.

state.description: The workflow state of this revision. Currently five states are supported in DKAN.

get.summary: Get all revisions for an item.

parameters.name: revision_id
parameters.description: Revision identifier. Use "identifier" property from revision object.

put.description:
Object will be completely replaced; optional properties not included in the request will be deleted.

Automatic example not yet available; try retrieving a dataset via GET, changing values, and pasting to test. If no item exists with the provided identifier, it will be created.

patch.description:
Values provided will replace existing values, but required values may be omitted.

Automatic example not yet available; try retrieving a dataset via GET, changing values, removing unchanged properties, and pasting to test.

schema.title: Project Open Data Dataset
schema.description: The metadata format for all federal open data. Validates a single JSON object entry (as opposed to entire Data.json catalog).

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be dcat:Dataset for each Dataset.

title.title: Title
title.description: Human-readable name of the asset. Should be in plain English and include sufficient detail to facilitate search and discovery.

identifier.title: Unique Identifier
identifier.description: A unique identifier for the dataset or API as maintained within an Agency catalog or database.

description.title: Description
description.description: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) with sufficient detail to enable a user to quickly understand whether the asset is of interest.

accessLevel.title: Public Access Level
accessLevel.description: The degree to which this dataset could be made publicly-available, regardless of whether it has been made available. Choices: public (Data asset is or could be made publicly available to all without restrictions), restricted public (Data asset is available under certain use restrictions), or non-public (Data asset is not available to members of the public).

rights.title: Rights
rights.description: This may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies. This should also provide an explanation for the selected "accessLevel" including instructions for how to access a restricted file, if applicable, or explanation for why a "non-public" or "restricted public" data assetis not "public," if applicable. Text, 255 characters.

accrualPeriodicity.title: Frequency
accrualPeriodicity.description: Frequency with which dataset is published.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the dataset or API. Note that documentation other than a data dictionary can be referenced using Related Documents as shown in the expanded fields.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distribution’s describedBy URL.

modified.title: Last Modified
modified.description: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.

released.title: Release Date
released.description: Date on which the dataset is scheduled to be published.

nextUpdateDate.title: Next Update Date
nextUpdateDate.description: The date on which the dataset is expected to be updated next.

license.title: License
license.description: The license dataset or API is published with. See Open Licenses for more information.

spatial.title: Spatial
spatial.description: The spatial coverage of the dataset. Could include a spatial region like a bounding box or a named place.

temporal.title: Temporal
temporal.description: The start and end dates for which the dataset is applicable, separated by a "/" (i.e., 2000-01-15T00:45:00Z/2010-01-15T00:06:00Z).

isPartOf.title: Collection
isPartOf.description: The collection of which the dataset is a subset.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be org:Organization for each publisher

bureauCode.title: Bureau Code
bureauCode.description: Federal agencies, combined agency and bureau code from OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C in the format of 015:010.

programCode.title: Program Code
programCode.description: Federal agencies, list the primary program related to this data asset, from the Federal Program Inventory. Use the format of 015:001

contactPoint.title: Project Open Data ContactPoint vCard
contactPoint.description: A Dataset ContactPoint as a vCard object.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be vcard:Contact for contactPoint.

fn.title: Contact Name
fn.description: A full formatted name, e.g. Firstname Lastname.

hasEmail.title: Email
hasEmail.description: Email address for the contact name.

theme.title: Category
theme.description: Main thematic category of the dataset.

keyword.title: Tags
keyword.description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: A distribution is a container for the data object. Each distribution should contain one accessURL or downloadURL. When providing a downloadURL, also include the format of the file.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be dcat:Distribution for each Distribution.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable description of the file format of a distribution (i.e. csv, pdf, kml, etc.).

mediaType.title: Media Type
mediaType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distribution’s downloadURL.

downloadURL.title: Download URL
downloadURL.description: URL providing direct access to a downloadable file of a dataset.

accessURL.title: Access URL
accessURL.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset.

conformsTo.title: Data Standard
conformsTo.description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the distribution conforms to.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the distribution found at the downloadURL.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distribution’s describedBy URL.

references.title: Related Documents
references.description: Related documents such as technical information about a dataset, developer documentation, etc.

archiveExclude.title: Exclude from Archive
archiveExclude.description: For excluding this dataset from its provider's 'download all datasets'.

put.description:
Object will be completely replaced; optional properties not included in the request will be deleted.

Automatic example not yet available; try retrieving a dataset via GET, changing values, and pasting to test. If no item exists with the provided identifier, it will be created.

patch.description:
Values provided will replace existing values, but required values may be omitted.

Automatic example not yet available; try retrieving a dataset via GET, changing values, removing unchanged properties, and pasting to test.

parameters.name: fulltext
parameters.description: Full-text search to run against any metadata fields indexed for fulltext searches.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of the result set.

parameters.name: page-size
parameters.description: How many results per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Which property to sort results on. Available properties: access_level, description, keyword, modified, theme, title, title_string, search_api_relevance

parameters.name: sort-order
parameters.description: Sort results in ascending or descending order. Allowed values: asc, desc

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: Request information on facets. Pass a comma-separated list to get specific facets. Pass an empty value or "0" for no facet infrmation. Omit this parameter to get all facet information.

parameters.name: theme
parameters.description: Filter results using theme facet.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Filter results using keyword facet.

results.description: An object with keys following the format "dkan_dataset/[uuid]", containing full dataset objects from the DKAN metastore.
An object with keys following the format "dkan_dataset/[uuid]", containing full dataset objects from the DKAN metastore.

data.description: Arbitrary object storing more detailed data on the error message.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Resources to query against and aliases. Usually you will add only one resource to this array, but if performing a join, list the primary resource first and then add resources to be used in the joins array.

alias.description: Alias to use to refer to this resource elsewhere in the query.

conditions.description: Conditions or groups of conditions for the query, bound by 'and' operator.

groupings.description: Properties or aliases to group results by.

limit.description: Limit for maximum number of records returned. Pass zero for no limit (may be restricted by user permissions).

offset.description: Number of records to offset by or skip before returning first record.

count.description: Return a count of the total rows returned by the query, ignoring the limit/offset.

results.description: Return the result set. Set to false and set count to true to receive only a count of matches.

schema.description: Return the schema for the datastore collection.

keys.description: Return results as an array of keyed objects, with the column machine names as keys. If false, results will be an array of simple arrays of values.

format.description: Format to return data in. Default is JSON, can be set to CSV.

rowIds.description: Flag to include the result_number column in output. Default is FALSE

datastoreResourceQuery.title: Datastore Resource Query
datastoreResourceQuery.description: Schema for DKAN datastore queries. When querying against a specific resource, the "resource" property is always optional. If you want to set it explicitly, note that it will be aliased to simply "t".

conditions.description: Conditions or groups of conditions for the query, bound by 'and' operator.

groupings.description: Properties or aliases to group results by.

limit.description: Limit for maximum number of records returned. Pass zero for no limit (may be restricted by user permissions).

offset.description: Number of records to offset by or skip before returning first record.

count.description: Return a count of the total rows returned by the query, ignoring the limit/offset.

results.description: Return the result set. Set to false and set count to true to receive only a count of matches.

schema.description: Return the schema for the datastore collection.

keys.description: Return results as an array of keyed objects, with the column machine names as keys. If false, results will be an array of simple arrays of values.

format.description: Format to return data in. Default is JSON, can be set to CSV.

rowIds.description: Flag to include the result_number column in output. Default is FALSE

datastoreQueryResource.title: Datastore Query: resource
datastoreQueryResource.description: Alias to resource set in resources array. Not needed when only querying against one resource.

datastoreQueryProperty.title: Datastore Query: property
datastoreQueryProperty.description: The property/column or alias to filter by. Should not include collection/table alias.

datastoreQueryResourceProperty.title: Datastore Query: resourceProperty
datastoreQueryResourceProperty.description: Property name with optional collection/table alias.

datastoreQueryConditionGroup.title: Datastore Query: Conditional group
datastoreQueryConditionGroup.description: Group of conditions bound by 'and'/'or' operators.

datastoreQueryCondition.title: Datastore Query: Condition
datastoreQueryCondition.description: Condition object including property, value and operator. If querying only one resource, the "resource" does not need to be specified.

datastoreQueryExpression.title: Datastore Query: Expression
datastoreQueryExpression.description: Arithmetic or aggregate expression performed on one or more properties.

operator.description: Expression operator. Note that performing expressions on text or other non-numeric data types my yield unexpected results.

operands.description: Arithmetic operators will require two operands, aggregate operators should take only one. Do not combine arithmetic and aggregate operators in a single query.

datastoreQuerySort.title: Datastore Query: sort
datastoreQuerySort.description: Properties to sort by in a particular order.

endpoint.description: Path to the metadata from the API.

identifier.description: Identifier for metadata just created or modified.

published.description: Is this the currently published revision?.

state.description: The workflow state of this revision. Currently five states are supported in DKAN.

metastoreNewRevision.description: When creating a new revision, you may only submit a message and state.

state.description: The workflow state of this revision. Currently five states are supported in DKAN.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the distribution found at the downloadURL.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distribution’s describedBy URL.

references.title: Related Documents
references.description: Related documents such as technical information about a dataset, developer documentation, etc.

archiveExclude.title: Exclude from Archive
archiveExclude.description: For excluding this dataset from its provider's 'download all datasets'.

type.description: Machine name for the metastore property to filter on.

name.description: The facet filter value, for instance, the tet of a keyword to filter by

total.description: Number of results in the current result set that match this filter.

400BadJson.description: Bad request, usually JSON schema validation failure.

data.message: The attribute expected to be of type ''object'' but 'array' given.

404IdNotFound.description: Not found, usually due to incorrect identifier.

200JsonOrCsvQueryOk.description: Ok. JSON or CSV datastore response, depending on query.

anyOf.description: Schema of all resources queries, keyed by ID.

409MetadataAlreadyExists.description: Conflict; tried to create a record using an existing ID, or metadata contains identifier that doesn't match the request path.

404MetadataObjectNotFound.description: Missing object, usually due to incorrect identifier.

example.message: No data with the identifier 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 was found.

datastoreUuid.name: identifier
datastoreUuid.description: A datastore id. Note: there is an inconsistency in this API that will be addressed in the future: The expected format is different from the format supplied in /api/1/datastore/imports.

datastoreDistributionIndex.name: index
datastoreDistributionIndex.description: The index of a distribution in a dataset's distribution array. For instance, the first distribution in a dataset would have an index of "0," the second would have "1", etc.

showReferenceIds.name: show-reference-ids
showReferenceIds.description: Metastore objects often include references to other objects stored in other schemas. These references are usually hidden in responses. Some identifiers are necessary to work with other API endpoints (e.g. datastore endpoints may require the distribution identifier). Add `?show-reference-ids` to show the identifiers generated by DKAN.

schemaId.name: schema_id
schemaId.description: The name a of a specific schema. For instance, "dataset."
